newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco says Shell firm to invest $11.5 in study.
newsitem.headline: Morocco says Shell firm to invest $11.5 in study.

text.p: The oil giant group Royal Dutch Shell is expected to invest the equivalent of $11.5 million for a feasability study aimed at extracting oil from bituminous shales, the official Moroccan radio RTM said on Thursday.
RTM, quoting Energy Minister Abdellatif Guerraoui, said "Shell company will carry a feasability study on Morocco's bituminous shales to produce cheap oil products in future."
Guerraoui was addressing the parliament's weekly session, but gave no other details, RTM added.
Morocco has one of the world's biggest shale deposits estimated at 120 million tonnes, of which 80 percent are found in the southern province of Tarfaya on the Atlantic coast.
Morocco, which has practically no oil of its own, imported the equivalent of more than $700 million of crude oil, mainly from Saudi Arabia and Iran in 1995.
